xlr.label: XLR (Analog Audio)
xlr.note: Balanced, can reach up to ~100 m in good conditions (studio, isolators).

dmx.label: DMX512 (Lighting)
dmx.note: Up to 300 m theoretically, but use a repeater/splitter beyond 100 m.

artnet.label: Art-Net / sACN
artnet.note: IP protocol; physical limit related to Ethernet cable (Cat5e/6 max 100 m on copper).

video.label: HD-SDI Video
video.note: HD‑SDI ~70 m max, beyond that → fiber or active converter.

3g-sdi.label: 3G-SDI Video
3g-sdi.note: Typically 70 to 100 m max depending on cable (Belden 1694A recommended).

hdmi.label: HDMI (consumer)
hdmi.note: Max recommended length ~5–10 m without amplification; beyond that → optical or HDBaseT.

hdbaset.label: HDBaseT (video over Cat)
hdbaset.note: Up to 100 m (1080p/4K) via shielded Cat6a; uncompressed.

audioCat5.label: Audio over Cat5 (e.g., AES50, EtherSound)
audioCat5.note: Up to ~100 m, use solid Cat5e/Cat6 cable to avoid loss.

aes50.label: AES50
aes50.note: Up to ~80–100 m theoretically; shielded Cat5e is essential.

dante.label: Dante / Audio over IP
dante.note: Max 100 m on copper; fiber recommended beyond that.

madi.label: MADI (coax or fiber)
madi.note: Coax: up to 100 m; fiber: up to 2 km (multimode) or more with single-mode.

fiber.label: Multimode Optical Fiber
fiber.note: Multimode: up to 2 km; very low loss.

fiber-sm.label: Single-mode Optical Fiber
fiber-sm.note: Up to 10 km or more; used for long-distance or backbone links.

power.label: Power (electric)
power.note: Depends on wire gauge. Watch for voltage drop.

speakon.label: Speakon (Speaker Power)
speakon.note: Strongly depends on transmitted power and gauge (often 2.5 mm² or more).

powercon.label: PowerCON (locked power)
powercon.note: Same logic as power cable; gauge must match current.

socapex.label: Socapex (6 circuits)
socapex.note: Used to power multiple lighting circuits; be mindful of individual gauge.

multicore.label: Analog Multicore
multicore.note: Multiple grouped XLR lines; loss increases with shielding quality.

triax.label: Triax (broadcast cameras)
triax.note: Length up to 500 m depending on camera and cable; now often replaced by fiber.

coaxial.label: RF Coaxial (wireless antenna)
coaxial.note: Very sensitive to loss. Use low-loss cable (RG213, LMR400, etc).

usb.label: USB (cameras, control)
usb.note: Max recommended length without repeater: 5 m (USB 2.0), 3 m (USB 3.0).

midi.label: MIDI (musical control)
midi.note: Max 15 m passively. Beyond that: use MIDI to Ethernet/DMX converters.
